Title: The Rocky Mountains
Description: Painted during Bierstadt's first major expedition to the American West in 1859, this monumental work depicts the Wind River Range in Wyoming Territory.

Title: Among The Sierra Nevada Mountains
Description: Created following Bierstadt's 1863 journey to California, this luminous canvas captures the grandeur of the Sierra Nevada range.

Title: A Storm in the Rocky Mountains
Description: Commissioned by publisher James McHenry, this dramatic composition showcases Bierstadt's mastery of atmospheric perspective and theatrical lighting.

Title: Valley of the Yosemite
Description: Painted after Bierstadt's first visit to Yosemite Valley in 1863, this work helped introduce Eastern audiences to California's natural wonders.

Title: Emigrants Crossing the Plains
Description: This work captures the arduous journey of westward migration across the Great Plains.

Title: Kern River Valley California
Description: The scene features three horses and two riders in a valley with the Sierra Nevada mountains in the background, likely inspired by the area near the Kern River in California.

Title: View from the Wind River Mountains, Wyoming
Description: The painting was produced following Bierstadt's 1859 travels with the Lander Expedition into the then-Nebraska Territory (now Wyoming).

Title: Looking Down Yosemite Valley
Description: One of Bierstadt's most celebrated works, this panoramic view looks westward down Yosemite Valley from above, capturing the dramatic granite cliffs and waterfalls.

Title: Yosemite Falls
Description: These paintings served as early, influential images of the American West, promoting the natural wonders of the Yosemite area during the period it was established as a protected reserve.

Title: Weeping Oaks, Clear Creek
Description: Large live oak trees draped in Spanish moss line the quiet banks of Clear Creek. Soft light filters through the branches, reflecting on the still water and creating a peaceful, intimate Southern landscape.

Title: The Rocky Mountains, Landers Peak
Description: This scene depicts the majestic Wind River Range in Wyoming, celebrating the grandeur of the American West during the 19th-century era of westward exploration.

Title: Lake Tahoe, California
Description: The scenes feature rugged, steep Sierra Nevada mountains in the background and dense, uncultivated forests on the shore, emphasizing the grand scale of nature.

Title: The Grizzly Giant Sequoia, Mariposa Grove, California
Description: A Romantic-style oil painting capturing the massive scale of one of Yosemite's most famous trees. It highlights the tree's thick, textured bark, enormous girth, and serene forest surroundings, reflecting the 19th-century awe for the American West's natural wonders.

Title: Estes Park, Longs peak
Description: This painting captures the iconic view of Longs Peak, a landmark celebrated by 19th- and 20th-century artists for its dramatic alpine scenery and its role in inspiring early American landscape art in the Rocky Mountains.

Title: Sunrise in the Sierras
Description: The painting contrasts radiant, warm-toned, illuminated peaks against a moody, dark foreground, showcasing the dramatic, romanticized American West.

Title: Geyser, Yellowstone Park
Description: The painting captures the Old Faithful geyser in the act of erupting, utilizing a vertical composition that emphasizes the height of the steam and water.

Title: Winter in Yosemite
Description: The artwork depicts a tranquil winter landscape, featuring dramatic snowy mountains, frozen bodies of water, and snowy, dense forests.

Title: North Dome, Yosemite Valley
Description: North Dome is a prominent granite dome on the north rim of Yosemite Valley in Yosemite National Park, California. The paintings often feature it alongside Royal Arches and facing Half Dome.

Title: Niagara Falls
Description: A romanticized, dramatic depiction of the famous waterfall, emphasizing its raw power and majestic scale.

Title: Merced River, Yosemite Valley
Description: It features the tranquil Merced River reflecting towering granite cliffs like El Capitan and Cathedral Rocks, often with grazing horses or Indigenous figures in the foreground, showcasing a dramatic contrast between detailed, shadowed foregrounds and a luminous, misty, golden-lit background.
